name: The Odyssey
desc: An epic poem following Odysseus's ten-year journey home after the Trojan War, encountering gods, monsters, and temptations.

name: The Iliad
desc: An epic poem about the Trojan War, focusing on the rage of Achilles and the consequences of war.

name: Hamlet
desc: A tragedy about Prince Hamlet's quest for revenge against his uncle who murdered his father, the King of Denmark.

name: Romeo and Juliet
desc: A tragic love story about two young star-crossed lovers whose deaths ultimately unite their feuding families.

name: Macbeth
desc: A tragedy about a Scottish general who receives a prophecy that he will become King of Scotland and commits regicide to fulfill it.

name: The Canterbury Tales
desc: A collection of 24 stories told by pilgrims traveling to Canterbury, providing a vivid portrait of medieval English society.

name: Paradise Lost
desc: An epic poem retelling the biblical story of the Fall of Man, focusing on Satan's rebellion and Adam and Eve's expulsion from Eden.

name: Robinson Crusoe
desc: The story of a man shipwrecked on a desert island for 28 years, learning to survive and eventually finding companionship with Friday.

name: Gulliver's Travels
desc: A satirical novel following Lemuel Gulliver's travels to four fantastical lands, satirizing human nature and society.

name: Candide
desc: A satirical novella following the optimistic Candide as he experiences numerous misfortunes, questioning the philosophy of optimism.

name: The Scarlet Letter
desc: Set in Puritan Massachusetts, the story of Hester Prynne who bears a child out of wedlock and must wear a scarlet 'A' as punishment.

name: Uncle Tom's Cabin
desc: An anti-slavery novel that depicts the harsh reality of slavery and its impact on families, contributing to the abolitionist movement.

name: Walden
desc: A reflection on simple living in natural surroundings, documenting Thoreau's two-year experiment in self-sufficient living near Walden Pond.

name: Leaves of Grass
desc: A collection of poetry celebrating democracy, nature, love, and friendship, written in free verse and considered a masterpiece of American literature.

name: Madame Bovary
desc: The story of Emma Bovary, a doctor's wife who seeks escape from her provincial life through romantic affairs and material excess.

name: Great Expectations
desc: A bildungsroman following Pip, an orphan who receives a mysterious fortune and navigates social class, love, and identity in Victorian England.

name: A Tale of Two Cities
desc: Set during the French Revolution, the story follows characters in London and Paris, exploring themes of sacrifice, resurrection, and justice.

name: Oliver Twist
desc: The story of an orphan boy who escapes from a workhouse and falls in with a gang of pickpockets in London.

name: David Copperfield
desc: A semi-autobiographical novel following David Copperfield from childhood to maturity, chronicling his personal growth and relationships.

name: Bleak House
desc: A complex novel satirizing the English judicial system through the interminable case of Jarndyce and Jarndyce.

name: Ulysses
desc: A modernist novel following Leopold Bloom and Stephen Dedalus through Dublin on a single day, using stream-of-consciousness technique.

name: The Sound and the Fury
desc: A complex novel about the decline of the Compson family, told from multiple perspectives using stream-of-consciousness narration.

name: As I Lay Dying
desc: The story of the Bundren family's journey to bury their mother, Addie, told from 15 different perspectives.

name: Light in August
desc: A novel exploring themes of race, identity, and community in the American South through interconnected stories.

name: Absalom, Absalom!
desc: A complex narrative about Thomas Sutpen and his family, exploring the legacy of slavery and the decline of the South.

name: The Grapes of Wrath
desc: The story of the Joad family's migration from Oklahoma to California during the Dust Bowl, exposing the harsh realities of migrant workers.

name: Of Mice and Men
desc: A tragic story of two displaced migrant ranch workers during the Great Depression, exploring themes of friendship and dreams.

name: East of Eden
desc: A multi-generational saga set in California's Salinas Valley, retelling the biblical story of Cain and Abel.

name: Cannery Row
desc: A novel about the colorful characters living in a rundown waterfront district of Monterey, California.

name: The Pearl
desc: A parable about a poor Mexican pearl diver who finds a valuable pearl, only to have it bring tragedy to his family.

name: Invisible Man
desc: A groundbreaking novel about an unnamed African American man's journey from the South to Harlem, exploring identity and invisibility.

name: On the Road
desc: A semi-autobiographical novel about Sal Paradise's cross-country road trips with his friend Dean Moriarty, capturing the Beat Generation spirit.

name: Lolita
desc: A controversial novel about Humbert Humbert's obsession with a 12-year-old girl, written in beautiful, complex prose.

name: Catch-22
desc: A satirical anti-war novel about Captain Yossarian's attempts to avoid combat missions during World War II.

name: Slaughterhouse-Five
desc: An anti-war novel about Billy Pilgrim, a World War II veteran who becomes 'unstuck in time' and experiences his life out of order.

name: The Crying of Lot 49
desc: A postmodern novel about Oedipa Maas's investigation into a mysterious conspiracy involving a secret postal system.

name: Gravity's Rainbow
desc: A complex postmodern novel set during World War II, following various characters connected to the V-2 rocket program.

name: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
desc: A novel about Randle McMurphy's rebellion against the oppressive Nurse Ratched in a mental institution.

name: The Master and Margarita
desc: A satirical novel about the Devil's visit to Moscow, interwoven with the story of Pontius Pilate and Jesus.

name: The Unbearable Lightness of Being
desc: A philosophical novel about love, politics, and the meaning of life, set during the Prague Spring of 1968.

name: The Secret History
desc: A psychological thriller about a group of elite college students who become involved in a murder, exploring themes of morality and guilt.

name: The Goldfinch
desc: A coming-of-age novel about Theo Decker, who survives a terrorist attack at an art museum and becomes obsessed with a stolen painting.

name: The Little Friend
desc: A mystery novel about 12-year-old Harriet Cleve Dufresnes's investigation into her brother's murder in a small Mississippi town.

name: The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay
desc: A novel about two Jewish cousins who create a comic book superhero during the Golden Age of comics, exploring themes of escape and identity.

name: The Yiddish Policemen's Union
desc: An alternate history detective novel set in a Jewish settlement in Alaska, following detective Meyer Landsman's investigation.

name: Middlesex
desc: A multigenerational saga about Calliope Stephanides, an intersex person of Greek descent, exploring identity and family history.

name: The Virgin Suicides
desc: A novel about the mysterious suicides of five sisters in suburban Detroit, told from the perspective of neighborhood boys.

name: White Teeth
desc: A multi-generational novel about two families in London, exploring themes of race, immigration, and cultural identity.

name: On Beauty
desc: A novel about two feuding academic families, exploring themes of beauty, race, and class in contemporary America.

name: NW
desc: A novel about four Londoners from the same housing estate, exploring class, friendship, and the complexities of modern urban life.

name: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
desc: A journalist and a hacker investigate a decades-old disappearance, uncovering dark family secrets and corruption.

name: The Girl Who Played with Fire
desc: Lisbeth Salander becomes the prime suspect in a triple murder, forcing her to confront her traumatic past.

name: The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest
desc: The final book in the trilogy, as Salander fights for her life and freedom while exposing a government conspiracy.

name: Gone Girl
desc: A psychological thriller about the disappearance of Amy Dunne and the suspicion that falls on her husband Nick.

name: Sharp Objects
desc: A journalist returns to her hometown to cover a series of murders, confronting her own traumatic past.

name: Dark Places
desc: A woman who survived her family's massacre investigates what really happened that night, uncovering shocking truths.

name: The Da Vinci Code
desc: A symbologist and a cryptologist race to solve a murder and uncover a secret that could shake the foundations of Christianity.

name: Angels & Demons
desc: Robert Langdon investigates a murder at CERN and uncovers a plot by the Illuminati to destroy the Vatican.

name: The Lost Symbol
desc: Robert Langdon races through Washington D.C. to solve mysteries involving Freemasonry and ancient symbols.

name: Inferno
desc: Robert Langdon wakes up in Florence with amnesia and must race against time to prevent a global catastrophe.

name: The Shining
desc: A writer takes a job as winter caretaker at an isolated hotel, where supernatural forces drive him to madness.

name: It
desc: Seven adults return to their hometown to confront a shape-shifting evil that terrorized them as children.

name: The Stand
desc: A post-apocalyptic novel about survivors of a plague that wipes out most of humanity, forming two opposing camps.

name: Carrie
desc: A bullied high school girl with telekinetic powers seeks revenge on her tormentors at the prom.

name: Pet Sematary
desc: A doctor discovers an ancient burial ground that brings the dead back to life, with horrifying consequences.

name: Misery
desc: A novelist is held captive by his 'number one fan' who forces him to write a new book to her specifications.

name: The Green Mile
desc: A death row corrections officer's experiences with an inmate who possesses mysterious healing powers.
A high school teacher travels back in time to prevent the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

name: The Outsider
desc: A detective investigates a brutal murder, but the evidence points to an impossible suspect.

name: The Institute
desc: A boy with telekinetic powers is kidnapped and taken to a secret facility where children with special abilities are studied.

name: The Help
desc: Set in 1960s Mississippi, a young white woman and black maids work together to write a book exposing racial injustice.

name: Water for Elephants
desc: An elderly man recalls his experiences as a veterinarian in a traveling circus during the Great Depression.

name: The Time Traveler's Wife
desc: A love story about a man with a genetic disorder that causes him to time travel unpredictably and his wife who waits for him.

name: The Lovely Bones
desc: A murdered 14-year-old girl watches from heaven as her family deals with her death and searches for her killer.

name: A Thousand Splendid Suns
desc: The story of two Afghan women from different generations whose lives become intertwined through marriage to the same abusive man.

name: And the Mountains Echoed
desc: A multi-generational novel about how a single act of sacrifice affects families across decades and continents.

name: I Am the Messenger
desc: A 19-year-old cab driver receives mysterious playing cards that lead him to help people in need.

name: Bridge of Clay
desc: The story of five brothers and their journey to build a bridge that will bring their family back together.

name: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
desc: A reclusive Hollywood icon finally decides to tell her life story to an unknown journalist, revealing secrets about her seven marriages.

name: Daisy Jones & The Six
desc: An oral history of a fictional 1970s rock band, told through interviews with band members and those who knew them.

name: Malibu Rising
desc: Four famous siblings throw an epic party that ends in disaster, revealing family secrets and changing their lives forever.

name: The Midnight Library
desc: A woman finds herself in a library between life and death where she can try out different versions of her life.

name: The Thursday Murder Club
desc: Four retirees in a retirement village form a murder club and find themselves investigating a real murder.

name: The Man Who Died Twice
desc: The Thursday Murder Club returns to solve another mystery involving stolen diamonds and a dangerous criminal.

name: The Bullet That Missed
desc: The Thursday Murder Club investigates a cold case involving a missing journalist and a mysterious death.

name: Project Hail Mary
desc: A lone astronaut must save humanity from an extinction-level event, using science and ingenuity to solve impossible problems.

name: The Martian
desc: An astronaut stranded on Mars must use his engineering skills and resourcefulness to survive until rescue.

name: Artemis
desc: A smuggler on the moon city of Artemis gets caught up in a conspiracy that threatens the entire settlement.

name: The Testaments
desc: The sequel to The Handmaid's Tale, told from the perspectives of three women in Gilead, revealing how the regime might fall.

name: Oryx and Crake
desc: A post-apocalyptic novel about Snowman, possibly the last human, who recalls his friendship with the brilliant but dangerous Crake.

name: The Year of the Flood
desc: A parallel narrative to Oryx and Crake, following two women in a religious group who survive a global pandemic.

name: MaddAddam
desc: The conclusion of the trilogy, as survivors of the pandemic work to rebuild civilization with the help of genetically engineered beings.

name: Alias Grace
desc: Based on a true story, a doctor interviews Grace Marks, a convicted murderer, to determine if she is guilty or insane.

name: The Blind Assassin
desc: An elderly woman writes a memoir revealing the truth about her sister's death and a novel within a novel.

name: Cat's Eye
desc: A painter returns to Toronto and confronts memories of her childhood, particularly her complex relationship with a childhood friend.

name: Surfacing
desc: A woman returns to her childhood home in remote Quebec to search for her missing father, undergoing a psychological transformation.

name: The Edible Woman
desc: A young woman's engagement triggers an identity crisis, causing her to develop an eating disorder as a form of rebellion.

name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
desc: Harry's second year at Hogwarts is threatened by a mysterious monster attacking students, and he must uncover the truth about the Chamber of Secrets.

name: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
desc: Harry learns about his parents' past and confronts Sirius Black, an escaped prisoner who may be after him.

name: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
desc: Harry is mysteriously entered into the Triwizard Tournament, facing dangerous challenges and the return of Lord Voldemort.

name: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
desc: Harry forms Dumbledore's Army to fight against the Ministry's denial of Voldemort's return and prepares for the coming war.

name: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
desc: Harry learns about Voldemort's past through Dumbledore's memories while the wizarding world prepares for war.

name: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
desc: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Horcruxes while Voldemort takes control of the wizarding world, leading to the final battle.

name: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire
desc: Katniss and Peeta are forced to compete in a special edition of the Hunger Games with previous winners.

name: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay
desc: Katniss becomes the symbol of rebellion as the districts rise up against the Capitol in a full-scale revolution.

name: The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes
desc: A prequel to The Hunger Games, following a young Coriolanus Snow as he mentors a tribute in the 10th Hunger Games.

name: The Night Circus
desc: Two young magicians are bound in a competition that takes place in a mysterious circus that only appears at night.

name: The Starless Sea
desc: A graduate student discovers a mysterious book that leads him to a hidden underground library filled with stories.

name: Circe
desc: A retelling of Greek mythology from the perspective of Circe, the witch who turned Odysseus's men into pigs.

name: The Song of Achilles
desc: A retelling of the Iliad from the perspective of Patroclus, focusing on his relationship with Achilles.

name: The Seven Deaths of Evelyn Hardcastle
desc: A man wakes up in a different body each day at a party, reliving the same day until he solves a murder.

name: The Devil and the Dark Water
desc: A detective and his assistant investigate supernatural occurrences on a ship crossing the Indian Ocean in 1634.

name: The Silent Patient
desc: A psychotherapist becomes obsessed with treating a woman who refuses to speak after allegedly murdering her husband.

name: The Maidens
desc: A group therapist investigates a series of murders at Cambridge University, suspecting a Greek tragedy professor.

name: The Guest List
desc: A wedding on a remote Irish island turns deadly when a guest is murdered, and everyone has a motive.

name: The Paris Apartment
desc: A woman arrives in Paris to stay with her half-brother, only to find him missing and his neighbors suspicious.

name: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue
desc: A young woman makes a deal with the devil for immortality, but is cursed to be forgotten by everyone she meets.

name: A Darker Shade of Magic
desc: A magician who can travel between parallel Londons must stop a dangerous artifact from destroying all worlds.

name: Don Quixote
desc: The story of a man who reads so many chivalric romances that he loses his sanity and decides to become a knight-errant.

name: The Count of Monte Cristo
desc: A tale of revenge and redemption following Edmond Dants, who escapes from prison and seeks vengeance against those who wronged him.

name: Les Misrables
desc: An epic novel about Jean Valjean's journey from prisoner to mayor, set against the backdrop of the French Revolution.

name: War and Peace
desc: A sweeping epic about five aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Wars, exploring themes of love, war, and destiny.

name: Anna Karenina
desc: A tragic love story about Anna Karenina, a married aristocrat who falls in love with Count Vronsky.

name: Crime and Punishment
desc: A psychological thriller about Raskolnikov, a poor student who commits murder and struggles with guilt and redemption.

name: The Brothers Karamazov
desc: A philosophical novel about three brothers and their relationships with their father, exploring themes of faith, doubt, and morality.

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
desc: A philosophical novel about a young man who remains youthful while his portrait ages, exploring themes of beauty and morality.

name: Dracula
desc: An epistolary novel about Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England and the battle to stop him.

name: Frankenstein
desc: The story of Victor Frankenstein, a scientist who creates a sentient creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

name: The Great Gatsby
desc: A story about Jay Gatsby's obsession with Daisy Buchanan, set in the Jazz Age of 1920s America.

name: The Sun Also Rises
desc: A novel about a group of American and British expatriates who travel from Paris to Pamplona for the running of the bulls.

name: A Farewell to Arms
desc: A love story set during World War I, following an American ambulance driver and a British nurse.

name: For Whom the Bell Tolls
desc: A novel about an American fighting in the Spanish Civil War, exploring themes of love, death, and sacrifice.

name: The Old Man and the Sea
desc: The story of an aging Cuban fisherman's struggle with a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream.

name: Beloved
desc: A novel about Sethe, a former slave haunted by the ghost of her dead daughter, exploring the trauma of slavery.

name: Song of Solomon
desc: A coming-of-age story about Macon Dead III, exploring themes of identity, family, and African American history.

name: The Color Purple
desc: An epistolary novel about Celie, an African American woman in the South, and her journey to self-discovery.

name: Their Eyes Were Watching God
desc: The story of Janie Crawford's search for love and identity through three marriages in early 20th century Florida.

name: Native Son
desc: A novel about Bigger Thomas, a young African American man whose life takes a tragic turn after he accidentally kills a white woman.

name: Bel Canto
desc: A novel about a hostage situation at a birthday party for a Japanese businessman in South America.

name: Commonwealth
desc: A novel spanning five decades about two families brought together by an affair and a tragic accident.

name: The Dutch House
desc: A story about a brother and sister who are exiled from their childhood home and their bond that lasts a lifetime.

name: The Overstory
desc: A novel about nine Americans whose lives become intertwined with trees, exploring humanity's relationship with nature.

name: The Echo Maker
desc: A novel about a man who suffers from Capgras delusion after a car accident and his sister's quest to help him.

name: The Orphan Master's Son
desc: A novel about Jun Do, an orphan in North Korea who rises through the ranks of the regime.

name: The Sympathizer
desc: A novel about a Vietnamese spy who flees to America after the fall of Saigon, exploring themes of identity and loyalty.

name: The Committed
desc: The sequel to The Sympathizer, following the protagonist as he becomes involved in the drug trade in Paris.

name: Lincoln in the Bardo
desc: A novel about Abraham Lincoln's grief over his son's death, told from the perspective of ghosts in a cemetery.

name: Tenth of December
desc: A collection of short stories exploring themes of class, power, and human connection in contemporary America.

name: Where the Crawdads Sing
desc: A mystery novel about Kya, the 'Marsh Girl' who grows up isolated in the marshes of North Carolina.

name: Educated
desc: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a survivalist Mormon family and eventually earns a PhD from Cambridge.

name: Becoming
desc: A memoir by the former First Lady of the United States, chronicling her life from childhood to the White House.

name: The Tattooist of Auschwitz
desc: A novel based on the true story of Lale Sokolov, a Slovakian Jew who became the tattooist at Auschwitz.

name: The Boy in the Striped Pajamas
desc: A story about the friendship between a German boy and a Jewish boy in a concentration camp during World War II.

name: The Book of Lost Names
desc: A novel about a young woman who forges documents to help Jewish children escape Nazi-occupied France.

name: The Nightingale
desc: A novel about two sisters in France during World War II and their different paths of resistance.

name: The Four Winds
desc: A novel about a woman's struggle to survive during the Great Depression and the Dust Bowl.

name: Firefly Lane
desc: A story about the lifelong friendship between two women from their teenage years through adulthood.

name: The Giver
desc: A dystopian novel about a boy who discovers the dark truth behind his seemingly perfect society.

name: The Maze Runner
desc: A dystopian novel about Thomas, who wakes up in a maze with no memory and must find a way out.

name: The Scorch Trials
desc: The second book in the Maze Runner series, following Thomas and his friends through the Scorch.

name: The Death Cure
desc: The final book in the Maze Runner trilogy, as Thomas fights to save his friends and find a cure.

name: Divergent
desc: A dystopian novel about Beatrice Prior, who lives in a society divided into five factions.

name: Insurgent
desc: The second book in the Divergent series, as Tris fights against the faction system.

name: Allegiant
desc: The final book in the Divergent trilogy, revealing the truth about the world outside the city.

name: The Fault in Our Stars
desc: A love story about two teenagers who meet in a cancer support group.

name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
desc: A collection of twelve short stories featuring the famous detective Sherlock Holmes and his friend Dr. Watson.

name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
desc: Sherlock Holmes investigates the mysterious death of Sir Charles Baskerville and the legend of a supernatural hound.

name: Pride and Prejudice
desc: The story of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy, exploring themes of love, class, and social expectations in Regency England.

name: Sense and Sensibility
desc: The story of the Dashwood sisters, Elinor and Marianne, as they navigate love and loss in early 19th-century England.

name: Emma
desc: A comedy of manners about Emma Woodhouse, a wealthy young woman who meddles in the romantic lives of others.

name: Jane Eyre
desc: The story of Jane Eyre, an orphan who becomes a governess and falls in love with her employer, Mr. Rochester.

name: Wuthering Heights
desc: A tale of passion and revenge on the Yorkshire moors, following Heathcliff and Catherine's destructive love.

name: Tender Is the Night
desc: The story of a young psychiatrist and his wife, exploring themes of love, wealth, and mental illness in the 1920s.

name: This Side of Paradise
desc: Fitzgerald's debut novel about Amory Blaine, a young man's journey through Princeton and the Jazz Age.

name: Origin
desc: Robert Langdon travels to Spain to attend a major announcement that will change the face of science forever.

name: The Handmaid's Tale
desc: A totalitarian society subjects women to state-sanctioned sexual servitude.

name: The Hunger Games
desc: In a dystopian future, Katniss Everdeen volunteers to take her sister's place in a televised fight to the death.

name: A Gathering of Shadows
desc: The second book in the Shades of Magic series, as Kell and Lila compete in a magical tournament.

name: A Conjuring of Light
desc: The final book in the Shades of Magic trilogy, as an ancient enemy threatens to destroy all worlds.

name: The Invisible Man
desc: A scientist discovers how to make himself invisible, but the power drives him to madness and crime.

name: The Time Machine
desc: A Victorian scientist travels to the year 802,701 AD and discovers a divided human race.

name: The War of the Worlds
desc: Martians invade Earth, and humanity must fight for survival against superior alien technology.

name: The Island of Dr. Moreau
desc: A shipwrecked man discovers an island where a mad scientist creates human-animal hybrids.

name: The First Men in the Moon
desc: Two men travel to the moon and discover an advanced civilization of insect-like creatures.

name: The Food of the Gods
desc: Scientists create a food that causes massive growth, leading to a conflict between giants and normal humans.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
desc: The story of Holden Caulfield, a troubled teenager who wanders New York City after being expelled from prep school.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
desc: A young girl in the American South witnesses racial injustice and learns about empathy and courage from her father.
A dystopian novel about Winston Smith, who rebels against a totalitarian regime that controls every aspect of life.

name: Animal Farm
desc: An allegorical novella about farm animals who rebel against their human owner, only to face a new tyranny.

name: Lord of the Flies
desc: A group of British boys stranded on an uninhabited island attempt to govern themselves, with disastrous results.

name: Brave New World
desc: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic world where society is controlled through pleasure and conditioning.

name: Fahrenheit 451
desc: A firefighter in a future society where books are banned must question his role and beliefs.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
desc: The first volume of The Lord of the Rings, following Frodo Baggins as he begins his quest to destroy the One Ring.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
desc: The second volume, as the Fellowship is broken and the war for Middle-earth intensifies.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
desc: The final volume, as the forces of good and evil clash in the ultimate battle for Middle-earth.

name: The Hobbit
desc: The story of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who joins a group of dwarves on a quest to reclaim their homeland.

name: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
desc: Four children enter a magical world through a wardrobe and help Aslan defeat the White Witch.

name: The Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian
desc: The Pevensie children return to Narnia to help Prince Caspian reclaim his throne.

name: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
desc: Edmund and Lucy join Prince Caspian on a voyage to find seven lost lords of Narnia.

name: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Silver Chair
desc: Eustace and Jill must find Prince Rilian, who has been captured by an evil witch.
